ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed knowledge on filmmaking, storytelling, the ethics of documentary, as well as the hard skills needed to produce films, i.e. cinematography, editing, and audio work.
I have learned the basica of how to use a camera, work sound, and edit using premiere pro cc. I have also learned how to develop a story by watching a number of documentary films of various styles.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: it provides you a great opportunity to make a film and the professors offer all the help you need to do so. Weaknesses: I guess it would be helpful to have more structured tutorials on working with software, although the class does provide ample time to teach yourself shortcuts in editing programs, so this is not a major weakness at all.
More time to work on our own projects is always better. While I enjoy brief updates in others work it can sometimes go on and on for a long time which seems to take up a lot more time than necessary.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If another student is looking to produce a film and is passionate about putting in the work necessary to do this, documentary filmmaking would be a great course for them.
